claim: Videos of empty hospitals show the COVID-19 is fake.
label: FALSE

claim: Main hospital in São Paulo, Brazil, has no patients infected with COVID-19.
label: FALSE

claim: A man named Antonio Carlos, aged 67, was treated in Hospital Unimed-Rio and healed with chloroquine treatment.
label: FALSE

claim: A video by a Russia blogger who claims that a Spanish hospital he is recording, is empty and that the information on the spread of the coronavirus is exaggerated.
label: FALSE

claim: The field hospital built in a football stadium in São Paulo (Brazi) to receive COVID-19 patients is empty.
label: False

claim: A man called Antonio Carlos, 67 years old, has just been cured of COVID-19 by using chloroquine. He was released from Unimed Hospital, in Rio de Janeiro (Brazil).
label: False

claim: A photo of a woman lying in a hospital bed with medical equipment attached to her body has been shared hundreds of times on Facebook and Twitter alongside claims that the woman was a doctor who died after being beaten by a Muslim mob while trying to administer novel coronavirus tests.
label: FALSE

claim: An audio of an alleged pulmonologist at the Regional University Hospital of Malaga who talks about cures for coronavirus.
label: Explanatory

claim: Indian Singer Kanika Kapoor was treated in Mumbai Wockhardt Hospital for COVID-19; the hospital was shut down as staff got infected.
label: False

claim: Video of a man belonging to Tabligi Jamaat stripped naked and vandalizing the hospital where he’s put under quarantine.
label: False

claim: A video of a man in front of the Pacaembu Stadium, in São Paulo, where a field hospital for COVID-19 patients was built. He claims that, since there’s no movement in the entrance, no one waiting to get in, there’s no one inside either.
label: False

claim: Luis Fernando Camacho, presidential candidate of the political party Creemos, donated respirators to Bolivian hospitals to combat COVID-19.
label: False

claim: Leonardo Da Vinci Hospital, a COVID-19 reference hospital in Fortaleza, Brazil, is empty. A video “proves” there was no one at the areas open to the public.
label: False

claim: Roberto Gazolla, a COVID-19 reference hospital in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, is empty. Photos “prove” there was no one at the areas open to the public, like the entrance hall.
label: False

claim: The coronavirus is only as dangerous as a flu, the diseases have the same death rate, air pollution and bad hygienic conditions in Italian hospitals (hospital germs) are responsible for the many death cases and only 5% of the whole population is endangered by COVID-19.
label: Partially false
